body:
Thanks for the issue, we will take it into consideration! Our team of engineers is busy working on many types of features, please give us time to get back to you.

Feature requests that require more discussion may be closed. Read more about our [feature request process](https://forem.dev/foremteam/internal-rfc-process-and-forem-dev-discussions-3gl4) on forem.dev.

To our amazing contributors: issues labeled `type: bug` are always up for grabs, but for feature requests, please wait until we add a `ready for dev` before starting to work on it.

To claim an issue to work on, please leave a comment. If you've claimed the issue and need help, please ping @forem/oss. The OSS Community Manager or the engineers on OSS rotation will follow up.

For full info on how to contribute, please check out our [contributors guide](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).

So what you're saying essentially is "Remove the hardcoded Home link and add it to the default navigation links so it can be removed/customized?", correct? In this context I want to point out the following issue that shows that removal might actually not work:

https://github.com/forem/forem/issues/15960

I think I also know why, see this comment:

https://github.com/forem/forem/issues/15960#issuecomment-1007109101

> "Remove the hardcoded Home link and add it to the default navigation links so it can be removed/customized?", correct?

Correct. 

> the following issue that shows that removal might actually not work

That's clearly a bug, but probably not blocking, or depending on, this issue, right?
Nevertheless, definitely worth pointing out. And even fixing :D

> That's clearly a bug, but probably not blocking, or depending on, this issue, right?

Well, we are making this change so that creators can potentially remove the Home link but they won't actually be able to remove it in a way that stays removed past deploys. But sure, the two issues can be tackled independent of each other.

issue.title: Code of Conduct, Privacy Policy, and Terms of Use Nav Links Keep Coming Back After Being Deleted

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

A number of non-DEV Forems are hoping to remove the default navigation links for Code of Conduct, Privacy Policy, and Terms of Use. They are able to successfully delete these links, but the links eventually come back. We're thinking this is likely happening when a Creator updates their cloud instance to the latest version of Forem.

**To Reproduce**

Here's [a video](https://www.loom.com/share/362b6914a7fd4eddb32f82355a481791) that shows how to remove the nav links.

Here's a more recent screenshot of jess.forem.lol (our Forem for testing) that shows the nav links have returned:

![Screen Shot 2022-01-05 at 9 44 23 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16007075/148236590-977e491b-2756-4501-b7b8-381f767ff5fb.png)

**Expected behavior**

Deleted nav links should be removed permanently unless they are added back. Updating the Forem should not revert any removed nav links.

issue.title: Make home link an admin-customisable navigation link

labels.name: PR: merged
labels.description: bot applied label for PR's that are merged

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:

     - ðŸ“— Update any related documentation and include any relevant screenshots.

     NOTE: Pull Requests from forked repositories will need to be reviewed by
     a Forem Team member before any CI builds will run. Once your PR is approved
     with a `/ci` reply to the PR, it will be allowed to run subsequent builds without
     manual approval.
-->

## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [X] Refactor
- [X] Feature
- [ ] Bug Fix
- [ ] Optimization
- [ ] Documentation Update

## Description

This changes the "Home" link that appears in the left sidebar to be a "Navigation Link", customisable/removable in the admin area.

I'd appreciate some backend eyes on this to make sure all is well with both new forems and forems that will get the new update deployed (based on the work done in https://github.com/forem/forem/pull/16112 and local testing, I believe we're all good). 

## Related Tickets & Documents

Closes https://github.com/forem/forem/issues/16076

## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

- Run the branch locally and check the "Home" link still appears in the sidebar
- Go to the navigation links admin area: `/admin/customization/navigation_links`
- Experiment with editing the Home link and check updates are reflected in the UI
- Delete the Home link and check it's now gone from the sidebar

### UI accessibility concerns?

N/A

## Added/updated tests?

- [X] Yes
- [ ] No, and this is why: _please replace this line with details on why tests
      have not been included_
- [ ] I need help with writing tests

## [Forem core team only] How will this change be communicated?

development process, or any of our internal teams? If so, please note how you
will share this change with the people who need to know about it._

      [Storybook](https://storybook.forem.com/) (for Crayons components)
- [ ] This PR changes the Forem platform and our documentation needs to be
      updated. I have filled out the
      [Changes Requested](https://github.com/forem/admin-docs/issues/new?assignees=&labels=&template=changes_requested.md)
      issue template so Community Success can help update the Admin Docs
      appropriately.
- [ ] I've updated the README or added inline documentation
- [ ] I've added an entry to
      [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/forem/forem/tree/main/CHANGELOG.md)
- [X] I will share this change in a [Changelog](https://forem.dev/t/changelog)
      or in a [forem.dev](http://forem.dev) post
- [ ] I will share this change internally with the appropriate teams
- [ ] I'm not sure how best to communicate this change and need help
- [ ] This change does not need to be communicated, and this is why not: _please
      replace this line with details on why this change doesn't need to be
      shared_

issue.title: Create/update by NavigationLink identity

labels.name: PR: merged
labels.description: bot applied label for PR's that are merged

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [x] Refactor
- [x] Optimization
- [x] Documentation Update

## Description

Prior to this commit, we were treating all NavigationLink attributes as
unique.  So, were we to change a position of one of the NavigationLinks
during the add_navigation_links rake task, we would have created a new
NavigationLink (and the only one would have remained).

With this commit, we're introducing the concept of the NavigationLink's
surrogate identity, that is to say if we have two NavigationLink objects
with the same `url` and `name` we should consider them the same
NavigationLink.  This allows us to update properties of those
NavigationLinks (via the rake task) without the risk of creating new
entries.

## Related Tickets & Documents

This unblocks PR #16268 which addresses #16076.

## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

This further helps address some subtle edge cases in our navigation management.

### UI accessibility concerns?

None.

## Added/updated tests?

- [X] Yes

## [Forem core team only] How will this change be communicated?

- [X] I will share this change internally with the appropriate teams
